comments.body: Would it be worth while to include the camelCase names in the docs with their corresponding snake_case doc snippets?
I don't see how it would hurt, and it would increase searchability for people already familiar with the API. I'll add them.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@
    - The names of module options are snake_cased versions of the camelCase ones found in the
      Keycloak API and its documentation at U(http://www.keycloak.org/docs-api/3.3/rest-api/)

    - The Keycloak API does not always enforce for only sensible settings to be used -- you can set

comments.body:
```
            - dict of registered cluster nodes (with C(nodename) as the key and last registration
              time as the value). This is 'registeredNodes' in KeyCloak REST API.
```

Example of mentioning the upstream api camel case name.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +218,222 @@        description:
            - dict of registered cluster nodes (with C(nodename) as the key and last registration
              time as the value).
              This is 'registeredNodes' in the Keycloak REST API.
        required: false
